Description.Html: 3D printing technicians manufacture products, including biomedical implants, car parts, aerospace components and fashion accessories.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Learn more about the basics of 3D printing.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get details about working in 3D printing and design engineering from the British Printing Industries Federation and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into research, investigating new materials for use in 3D printing and how to make them commercially workable. You could also train to work in 3D printing software and hardware development.

You might work for a company that specialises in printing particular items, for example custom-made prosthetics, construction prototypes, or models of archaeological remains and historical buildings.

There are also opportunities in print equipment sales and training.

Description.Html: Accommodation wardens manage the day-to-day running of services like sheltered housing, youth hostels and student flats.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a warden from the Chartered Institute of Housing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become an accommodation manager with responsibility for several centres and wardens. You could also work in housing or block management.

With further study, you could also work in a related field like social work or counselling.

Description.Html: Accounting technicians handle day-to-day financial matters in all types of business.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in accountancy from the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into management or become self-employed and work on accounts for small businesses. You could also study to become a qualified accountant.

AAT and ACCA qualifications are recognised across the world, so you could work overseas.

Description.Html: Acoustics consultants help manage and control noise and vibrations in homes, workplaces and other environments.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an acoustics consultant from the Institute of Acoustics.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a project leader, managing the design and development of new products. You might also specialise in a particular area, for example architectural, medical or underwater acoustics technology.

With experience, you could become a senior acoustics engineering consultant and register for chartered status through the Institute of Acoustics.

Description.Html: Actors use speech, movement and expression to bring characters to life in theatre, film, television and radio.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join Equity for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need to get as much practical experience of acting as you can, and create a showreel to demonstrate your acting skills to agents and casting directors.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming an actor through Get into Theatre and Discover Creative Careers.

You can also get extra support from organisations like Shape Arts, if you have a disability or special learning need.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
If you can show an agent you have potential they may put you forward for auditions and castings. Agents usually take a fee of about 10% to 25% from your earnings.

You could take further training and move into directing, scriptwriting, drama therapy or teaching.

Description.Html: Actuaries work with companies and government departments, to help them forecast long-term financial costs and investment risks.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Institute and Faculty of Actuaries to begin training and to take professional exams as you progress.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about careers in the actuarial profession, training and case studies from the Institute and Faculty of Actuaries.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a department manager and then a partner with a financial firm.

You could also specialise in a particular field, like life insurance or healthcare, or move into consultancy work, accountancy or banking.

Description.Html: Acupuncturists insert needles into pressure points on clients' bodies to help relieve everyday stresses, and improve their wellbeing.

HtbBodies.Html:
Work is currently ongoing for the statutory regulation of acupuncturists.

You may find it useful to join organisations like the British Acupuncture Council and Complementary and Natural Healthcare Council, for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about acupuncture careers from the British Acupuncture Accreditation Board and the British Acupuncture Council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could move into teaching or research.

Description.Html: Admin assistants give support to offices by organising meetings, typing documents and updating computer records.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Time management and the ability to prioritise tasks is really important in administration. This could be tested at interview. For example, you might be given some tasks to complete and asked to arrange them in order of importance.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress from admin assistant to supervisor or office manager. You could also move into other departments, like IT, payroll or accounting.

With further training, you could specialise in an area like legal, financial or medical administration.

Description.Html: Advertising account executives provide the link between an advertising agency and its clients.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It's a good idea to have a presence on social networking sites. You could also show your creative and communication skills to employers through your own blog or website.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about a career in advertising from the Institute of Practitioners in Advertising.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to account manager, become an agency director, or set up your own agency.

Description.Html: Advertising account planners develop and plan advertising campaigns to make sure they reach the right audience.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the APG for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in advertising from the IPA, the APG and Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a senior account planner or move into management.

You may choose to work as a freelance planning consultant, or set up your own agency.

Description.Html: Art directors design the visual side of advertising campaigns for all kinds of media including film, TV, web or print.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Your creativity and ability in art and design are the most important things to many employers.

When looking for jobs, you'll need to show a portfolio or 'book' of your work to potential employers, as you'll be employed on the strength of your artwork and ideas.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in advertising from the Institute of Practitioners in Advertising and Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to senior art director or creative director.

You could also work freelance or set up your own agency.

Some art directors move into directing for TV or film.

Description.Html: Advertising copywriters produce words for print, TV, radio and online adverts.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You could showcase your creative and communication skills through your own blog, website or social networking sites. You'll also need to develop a portfolio of your work to show potential employers.

You could also enter the D&AD New Blood competition, which is aimed at students and recent graduates not already employed in a creative role. It gives you the opportunity to work on real client briefs and showcase your work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an advertising copywriter from the Institute of Practitioners in Advertising and Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to senior copywriter and creative director.

You could also work freelance or set up your own agency.

Description.Html: Media buyers book advertising space in newspapers and magazines, and on TV, radio and the internet.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Employers will usually be more interested in your personal qualities, like creativity, quick thinking and business sense, as well as your formal qualifications.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about a career in advertising from the IPA and Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You might choose to specialise in buying radio, online or television advertising.

You could eventually become a media manager of an agency, or move into media planning, account planning or account management.

Description.Html: Advertising media planners decide which media is best suited to advertising their client's products or services.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Practitioners in Advertising, for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Any work experience in media, marketing, communications or sales would also be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming an advertising media planner from the Institute of Practitioners in Advertising.

You can also find out more about working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and a good track-record, you may progress into account management or become a senior planner or manager.

You could also go freelance.

Description.Html: Aerospace engineers design, build and maintain planes, spacecraft and satellites.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in aerospace engineering from Careers in Aerospace.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could specialise in a particular field like:

  • aerodynamics
  • fuel efficiency
  • space technology
  • investigating air accidents

You could also move up to become a project manager or consultant aerospace engineer.

Description.Html: Aerospace engineering technicians design, build, test and repair civil and military aircraft.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more on working and training in aerospace engineering from Careers in Aerospace and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into supervisory, project management and higher management roles, or specialise in a particular field, like aircraft design.

Description.Html: Agricultural contractors provide specialised, seasonal or temporary services to farmers.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the National Association of Agricultural Contractors, which can help with industry training and professional development.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Agricultural contracting can be competitive, with lots of contractors applying for the same work. It will help you to get jobs and build your business if you have a specialism that no one else in the surrounding area offers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more about working and training in agriculture from Tasty Careers and the National Land Based College.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into teaching, training or consultancy.

You could also work for private companies or co-operatives that offer management services to farms.

Description.Html: Agricultural engineers build, service and repair agricultural, horticultural and forestry machinery and equipment.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about careers and training from the Institution of Agricultural Engineers and the Landbased Engineering Training and Education Committee.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into project management or specialist technical research and development.

You could also work towards incorporated or chartered engineer status by applying to the Engineering Council. As a chartered engineer you’ll plan, research and develop new ideas. The Institution of Agricultural Engineers has more information.

You could also move into technical sales, business development, teaching or consultancy work.

Description.Html: Agricultural engineering technicians help to solve practical engineering problems in land-based industries.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about land-based careers and courses through the Institution of Agricultural Engineers and the Landbased Engineering Training and Education Committee.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, knowledge and industry contacts, you could become self-employed.

You could become a senior technician or workshop manager, or progress to a senior sales or management position.

You could also move into a training job as a college lecturer or technician, or take on an inspection role.

Description.Html: Agricultural inspectors make sure animal welfare regulations are followed in farms and dairies.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You're most likely to find jobs with a government-related agency, for instance:Department for Environment Food and Rural Affairs (DEFRA); Heath and Safety Executive; Red Tractor scheme

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working as an agricultural inspector from Tasty Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to a management role, or work as a consultant in occupational health.

You could move into public health or conservation work.

Description.Html: Agronomists advise farmers on soil management and crop production.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Association of Independent Crop Consultants and BASIS, for professional recognition and training opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It's really useful to get as much arable farming experience as possible.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become an agronomist from Tasty Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could specialise in precision farming methods or developing nutrition plans for fruit or vegetable crops.

You could also study for a postgraduate master's degree, like soil science or genetics, and become a consultant.

Description.Html: Aid workers help people in overseas countries affected by man-made and natural disasters like wars, outbreaks of disease and earthquakes.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it helpful to join an organisation like the International Association of Professionals in Humanitarian Assistance and Protection for training and development opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Follow aid organisations that interest you on social media to find out about opportunities. Think about small organisations, as well as the bigger, more well known ones.

You could also develop useful skills, like languages, first aid or driving. There is a move to recruit local people to do the frontline jobs during emergencies, so being able to offer specialist skills or knowledge will give you an advantage.

You’ll need to be willing to work long hours in challenging and often dangerous situations. You'll also need to show flexibility as well as being sensitive and culturally aware.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in international aid and the organisations involved from:United Nations careers; Disasters Emergency Committee; CharityJob

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You can develop your own unique career path by working with different organisations and in different parts of the world. With experience, you can move into senior management or advisory positions, making decisions on how relief efforts are co-ordinated.

Description.Html: Air accident investigators search for the causes of accidents and serious incidents, involving civilian aircraft.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become an investigator from the Air Accidents Investigation Branch.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
If you work as an engineering or flight data recorder investigator, you could become an operations director, co-ordinating the investigation process. You could also progress to chief accident inspector.

You could use your experience to work as a consultant with aerospace manufacturers, safety regulators or aviation industry insurance companies.

Description.Html: Air traffic controllers give information and advice to airline pilots to help them take off and land safely and on time.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Senior air traffic controllers' salaries can rise to over £100,000 at larger airports.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an air traffic controller from National Air Traffic Services.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into training and assessing new controllers, or become a supervisor or unit manager.

You could also move into operations management.

Description.Html: Airline customer service agents make sure passengers and their luggage safely board the right aircraft at the right time.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may find it useful to have experience of working in a customer service role.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about jobs in the passenger transport and travel industries from Careers That Move.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to a supervisory role, or a management position like flight dispatcher.

You could also move into other areas of airport operations, or train to become a cabin crew member.

Description.Html: Airline pilots fly passengers and cargo to destinations around the world.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
The Honourable Company of Air Pilots has a test for people with little or no flying experience. Pilot training is expensive and this could help you decide whether you're suited to this career before you spend money on training.

English is the international language of flying, so airlines will expect you to have a good GCSE pass, or equivalent, in the subject. Skills in another language can also give you an advantage, for example if you want to work for an overseas airline. It may also help you to stand out from other applicants, as competition for jobs is strong.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about training to become a pilot through Flying Start and the British Airline Pilots' Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You'll start by training as a co-pilot. When you’ve completed at least 1500 flying hours, you can apply for an 'unfrozen' or full Air Transport Pilot Licence (ATPL) and qualify as an airline captain. This will usually take 3 to 5 years after you get your full ATPL.

With experience, you could become a flight training instructor or an operations manager.

Description.Html: Airport baggage handlers load and unload luggage and cargo from aircraft.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Seasonal work may be available, with large increases in the number of travellers in busy holiday periods.

Jobs may be advertised on the websites of airport authorities and agencies, recruitment agencies and in local newspapers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a baggage handler from Careers That Move.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could work as a 'lead ramp hand', lining up planes ready for the next flight. You could also train staff on equipment and procedures.

You could move into supervisory management or passenger handling operations.

Description.Html: Airport information assistants help passengers in airports.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience in customer service would give you an advantage when looking for work. Foreign language skills might also be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working in the travel industry through Careers That Move.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: After gaining experience you could go on to be a supervisor, manager or flight dispatcher.

Description.Html: Ambulance care assistants take patients to and from hospital for appointments.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out about becoming an ambulance care assistant from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a team leader or supervisor. You could also become an emergency care assistant or apply to be a student paramedic.

You could also move into personnel, training, health and safety, or operations management.

Description.Html: Anaesthetists are doctors who give anaesthetics to patients before, during and after surgery.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about this career from the Royal College of Anaesthetists and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
As a consultant anaesthetist in the NHS, you may also find opportunities to work in the private sector. With experience you might lead or manage departments.

With experience and entry on the General Medical Council (GMC) Specialist Register, you could apply for senior (or consultant) roles.

You could also teach medical students, postgraduate doctors in training, nurses, midwives and paramedics.

Description.Html: Analytical textile technologists produce technical textiles for industries like automotive, aerospace and healthcare.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in textile technology from The Textile Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a senior technologist, leading a research and development team, move into quality control or become a technical production manager.

You might also move into buying or technical sales, working with materials suppliers and manufacturers of fashion and industrial textiles.

Description.Html: Anatomical pathology technicians (APTs) help pathologists carry out post-mortems in mortuaries.

HtbBodies.Html:
Once you have completed the diploma, including practical assessments and a written exam, you can apply for Associate Membership of the Royal Society of Public Health.

You can also join the Association of Anatomical Pathology Technology (AAPT), which represents and promotes the profession.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience of record keeping or dealing with legal issues might be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an anatomical pathology technician from Health Careers and the Association of Anatomical Pathology Technology.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and relevant qualifications, you could train other health professionals and move into more advanced technical work or management.

Description.Html: Animal care workers look after animals in places like kennels, rescue centres and sanctuaries.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in animal care from the National Land Based College UK and the College of Animal Welfare.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a supervisor or manager, or work self-employed.

You could also use your experience to move into other animal care careers, like veterinary nursing, or find work in a zoo or wildlife park.

Description.Html: Animal technicians look after animals in laboratories.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Working with animals or in a lab may help improve your chances of finding a job or training.

You could get work experience:

  • on a farm
  • in kennels, an animal welfare centre or zoo
  • in a laboratory setting

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find out more about careers and training from the Institute of Animal Technology.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior animal technologist, unit or section supervisor or manager.

You could also specialise in breeding, immunology or training.

Description.Html: Animators bring drawings and computer generated characters to life on screen.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need a showreel and portfolio to highlight your best animation work and ideas. Make your work easy to find, either on your own website or blog, or on a video-sharing website.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can get advice about working as an animator from ScreenSkills.

You can also find out more about working in the creative industries from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress from animator to lead animator and animation director.

You could also work for larger animation studios, games developers, interactive media designers or video post-production firms.

You might decide to go freelance or start your own studio.

Description.Html: Antique dealers buy and sell old objects and collectors' items.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need a good knowledge of antiques and the market. Sales skills, the ability to spot saleable items, and funds for starting up are likely to be more important than formal qualifications.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can discover more about working in antiques through the The British Antique Dealers' Association.

You can also find out more about working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could progress to become a specialist dealer, valuer or auctioneer.

Description.Html: App developers design and build mobile applications for PCs, mobile phones and tablets.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join The Chartered Institute for IT and the Institution of Analysts and Programmers, for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You can build up your skills and knowledge using free online learning resources for programming languages and apps development.

You'll also find it useful to have an understanding of Agile project development methods.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in computing from Tech Future Careers and Bubble Digital Career Portal.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into systems analysis, or be promoted to a senior app developer or applications project manager.

You could also become self-employed, offering your services through contracting in most areas of the economy, for example business, finance, cyber security, telecommunications and healthcare.

Description.Html: Arboricultural officers manage and maintain trees for local councils and arboricultural contractors.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in arboriculture from The Arboricultural Association and the Royal Forestry Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could manage a team of arboricultural officers, for example in a local authority, and co-ordinate work with outside contractors.

You could also work as a consultant, advising organisations on tree management, conservation and safety.

You may find opportunities with training providers who offer courses in arboriculture.

Description.Html: Archaeologists learn about the past by studying sites and excavating, classifying, recording and preserving objects.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Chartered Institute for Archaeologists for professional development training and networking opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience and qualifications in computer aided design (CAD), illustration and geographical information systems (GIS) can be helpful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice on how to become an archaeologist from the Council for British Archaeology.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You may find it useful to join a professional body like the Chartered Institute of Archaeologists.

With experience, you may be able to progress to a senior role like site supervisor or director.

You could also specialise in teaching or preservation.

Description.Html: Architects design new buildings and the spaces around them, and work on the restoration and conservation of existing buildings.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Royal Institute of British Architects, for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an architect from the Royal Institute of British Architects, the Architects Registration Board and Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
If you're working for a private architectural firm, you may be able to move up to become a partner or associate.

With experience in public sector roles, you could move into a lead architect job.

You could also work on projects as a freelance consultant, or set up your own business.

You may get opportunities to work overseas.

Description.Html: Architectural technicians work closely with architectural teams on the design process of building projects.

HtbBodies.Html: When you've completed an approved course you can apply for associate membership of the Chartered Institute of Architectural Technologists. This allows you to complete the professional qualification stage of your training.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It can help if you've got experience in the construction industry and knowledge of computer-aided design.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could work towards Associate or Affiliate membership of the Chartered Institute of Architectural Technologists.

With further training, you could work towards becoming an architectural technologist.

Description.Html: Architectural technologists manage all stages of the technical design and planning process of building projects.

HtbBodies.Html: When you've completed an approved course you can apply for associate membership of the Chartered Institute of Architectural Technologists. This allows you to complete the professional qualification stage of your training.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Any experience you have using computer-aided design or working in the construction industry can help you get into this career.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about becoming an architectural technologist through the Chartered Institute of Architectural Technologists.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Once you have at least 2 years' work experience, you can work towards Chartered Membership of the Chartered Institute of Architectural Technologists.

With experience you could move into management, work as a consultant or set up your own practice. You could also work in universities or research.

Description.Html: Archivists look after and preserve collections of historical records and documents.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Archives & Records Association and get access to industry news, professional development courses and networking events.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about careers and training in archives from the Archives & Records Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could work with larger and more prestigious organisations, like national archives and museums, businesses, church foundations and charities.

You could become self-employed.

Description.Html: Army officers command, manage and motivate teams of soldiers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about careers in the army, training and how to join through Army Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With training and experience, you could rise up through the ranks from lieutenant to captain, major, colonel and beyond.

On leaving active service, you could use your skills, qualifications and experience to go into a new career, for example in management, planning or teaching. The Officers' Association gives advice and support to officers on finding a career outside the army.

The Career Transition Partnership, Quest and Troops to Teachers also have more information on career options outside the armed forces.

Description.Html: Aromatherapists use essential oils to help improve their clients' emotional wellbeing and relieve everyday stresses.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join an accredited register managed by the International Federation of Aromatherapists, the Complementary and Natural Healthcare Council, or the Federation of Holistic Therapists.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in aromatherapy and how to choose a training course from the Aromatherapy Council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience as a self-employed practitioner, you could set up clinics at home or at other premises, or visit clients in their homes.

With further training, you could offer additional therapies, like reflexology or massage, to increase your income.

Description.Html: Art editors use words and images to make magazines look good and easy to read.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join the Professional Publishers Association (PPA) for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Internships can be a good way to get experience. This will help you to build a portfolio that showcases your print designs and art layout skills to employers. It will also give you a better understanding of the magazine industry.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can also find out more about working in art, publishing and other creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become an art director, or move to advertising agency work.

You could use your experience and industry contacts to become self-employed or set up your own design agency.

Description.Html: Art gallery curators manage collections of paintings and objects.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Museums Association for professional development and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming an art gallery curator from the Museums Association.

You can also find out more about working in related careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work in galleries ranging from very small independent galleries to large public sector and national institutions, like the National or Tate Gallery.

You could also work in a university gallery, or curate large companies’ collections.

You would usually have more opportunities for promotion if you worked in a large gallery.

Description.Html: Art therapists help people express difficult thoughts and feelings through creative activities.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the British Association of Art Therapists for access to professional development and networking opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You could try an introductory or foundation course in art therapy to give you an idea of what the work is like.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You'll find more details about this career, courses and training through the British Association of Art Therapists and Health Careers.

You can also find out more about working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become self-employed and build up your own practice.

You could also become a senior arts therapist and manage a team of therapists, manage an arts therapy unit, or move into teaching.

Description.Html: Art valuers give advice on how much a piece of art or a collection of art is worth.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Society of Fine Art Auctioneers and Valuers as an associate member, if you work for an auction house that's also a member.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about careers in this area from the Museums Association.

You can also get information about working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could set up your own business, offering a valuation service as well as buying and selling fine arts and antiques.

Description.Html: Assistance dog trainers and instructors train dogs that help people to maintain their independence.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an assistance dog trainer from:Guide Dogs; Hearing Dogs for Deaf People; Dogs for Good; Canine Partners; Dog A.I.D.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could progress to a role like area team supervisor, training manager or regional training manager.

Your experience as a trainer could lead to a care support job, like rehabilitation worker.

You could move into a related field, like veterinary nursing or working as an RSPCA inspector.

You could also set up your own business, and provide services like dog obedience classes or private dog training.

Description.Html: Assistant immigration officers check that people have the right to visit or stay in the UK.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience of working with the public will be helpful. You may also find it useful to speak another language, although this is not essential.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become an assistant immigration officer from Civil Service Careers and Border Force.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could become an immigration officer or move to other posts in the Civil Service.

Description.Html: Astronauts fly spacecraft and do experiments in space.

HtbCareerTips.Html: There's only a small number of astronaut training places available when recruitment occurs, and there's a lot of competition for them.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can discover more about how to become an astronaut from the European Space Agency and SpaceCareers.uk.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You’ll have several years’ training before you’re ready to be selected for a mission. It may take you years to be selected for a space flight. Once you’re selected, you’ll get mission specific training. Your flight in space could last between 6 months and a year.

With experience you could be selected for other missions. You could also move into management, teaching, research or set up your own consultancy business.

Description.Html: Astronomers study the origin and make-up of the universe, including its planets, stars, galaxies and black holes.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice on careers in astronomy from the Royal Astronomical Society and SpaceCareers.uk.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into related careers like aerospace or satellite research and development.

You could also use your skills in systems analysis, software engineering, teaching, scientific journalism or accountancy.

Description.Html: Athletes compete in track and field events for their clubs, and some go on to represent their country at international level.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Many athletes combine their career in track and field with study or a second job.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about how to become an athlete from British Athletics and UK Athletics.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into coaching with clubs, colleges and universities. Your experience would also be useful for jobs in community sports development or sports management.

You might also take further training to become a sports physiotherapist, nutritionist or sports scientist.

Description.Html: Audiologists work with children and adults who suffer from hearing loss, tinnitus, or have problems with balance.

HtbBodies.Html: You could register with The Registration Council for Clinical Physiologists to get access to professional development and networking opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an audiologist from:[British Academy of Audiology | https://www.baaudiology.org/careers/]; British Society of Hearing Aid Audiologists; Health Careers

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could go on to specialise in areas like balance rehabilitation, cochlear implants, or assisting people with learning disabilities or dual sensory loss.

With experience, you could lead a team, manage a unit, or move into a general management position in mainstream healthcare.

You could also take on a research or teaching post at a university.

Description.Html: Audio-visual technicians install and operate visual, sound and lighting equipment at conference centres, schools, colleges and events.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join organisations like PLASA or the Production Services Association, for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Employers value experience, so it would improve your chances of finding work if you've got experience of setting up and using audio, visual and computer technology.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about audio-visual careers and training from ScreenSkills.

You can also find out more about working in the creative industries from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could manage an audio-visual department, specialise in lighting or sound design, or become an events manager. You could also move into equipment and services sales.

You could work self-employed or freelance, for example installing audio-visual equipment in people's homes.

Description.Html: Internal and external auditors check organisations' financial records and procedures to make sure they are accurate and efficient.

HtbBodies.Html:
To be an external auditor, you'll need to be a qualified chartered accountant and a member of one of the following professional bodies:Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA); Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (ICAEW); The Association of International Accountants (AIA)

You'll need to be a member of the The Chartered Institute of Public Finance and Accountancy to carry out audits in the public sector.

If you're qualified as an accountant with the Chartered Institute of Management Accountants (CIMA), you can carry out internal audits.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in auditing from the Chartered Institute of Internal Auditors.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
As an experienced external auditor, you could move into management and then become a partner or finance director. You could also set up your own accountancy practice.

As an experienced internal auditor, you could move into a management role. You could also become a chartered internal auditor, or become a self-employed consultant.

Description.Html: Auto electricians fit and repair the electrics in motor vehicles.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an auto electrician from Autocity.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to be a supervisor or manager, or move into vehicle sales or marketing.

You could also set up your own business.

Description.Html: Automotive engineers design, develop, test and build cars and motorbikes.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in the automotive industry through Autocity and Your Future in Automotive.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to senior engineer roles, project team management, general management or consultancy.

Description.Html: Bailiffs visit properties to collect debts, serve court documents or give notices or summons.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find details on relevant training for enforcement officers from the Chartered Institute of Credit Management.

You can find out how to train as a high court enforcement officer from the High Court Enforcement Officers Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into a supervisory role, leading a team of bailiffs.

You could also move into senior management or business development.

Description.Html: Bakers make bread, cakes and pastries using machines or by hand.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Any experience you have of making or serving food may help you get into this job.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in the food and drinks industry from Tasty Careers and the Federation of Bakers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a bakery supervisor, charge hand or production manager.

As an in-store or industrial baker, you could move into a job at a flour mill or become a sales representative.

You could also become a technical adviser or development baker for a baked goods or equipment company.

Another option is to become a craft baker and set up your own business.

Description.Html: Bank managers oversee the day-to-day operations of their branch, supervise staff and work to attract new customers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more advice about training and working in banking from the London Institute of Banking and Finance and Chartered Banker Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work towards chartered banker status with the Chartered Banker Institute. This could help broaden your career options at senior management level.

With experience, you could take on responsibility for several branches in a local area or region. You could move into head office operations, or work with the bank's overseas division.

You could also work in corporate or investment banking.

Description.Html: Banking customer service advisers provide a face-to-face service in banks and building societies.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Customer service, cash handling and computing skills will be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in finance from The London Institute of Banking and Finance.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to specialist customer service and advice roles, or into management.

You might also be able to apply your customer service skills in corporate or investment banking.

Description.Html: Bar staff serve drinks in venues like pubs, clubs, wine bars, hotels and leisure centres.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in the drinks trade from:The Hospitality Guild; British Beer & Pub Association; Wine and Spirit Education Trust

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to supervisor, deputy bar manager and bar manager.

You could also become a publican or bar manager for a hotel chain.

Description.Html: Barbers cut and trim customers’ hair, beards and moustaches, following instructions or copying example styles.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a barber from the Hair and Beauty Industry Authority and National Hairdressers' Federation.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a senior barber. If you take further qualifications, you could move into training or assessing student barbers.

You could also open your own barbershop, either independently or as a franchise.

Description.Html: Baristas make and serve coffee in cafes, coffee shop chains, restaurants and hotels.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a barista from the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a store manager and then move on to a regional manager role.

You could also become self-employed and set up your own coffee shop.

Description.Html: Barristers give specialist legal advice, advising solicitors and representing people in court, at tribunals and in public inquiries.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join The Bar Council, for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a barrister from The Bar Council and All About Law.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could find employment with firms supplying legal services in commerce, finance or industry. You could lead a team or move into general management.

You could also apply to become a Queen's Counsel (QC), a judge or an ombudsman.

Description.Html: Barristers' clerks deal with the admin in barristers' offices and organise the barristers' workload.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a clerk in a barristers' office from the Institute of Barristers' Clerks.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you might become a senior barristers' clerk, chambers director or practice manager. In this role, you'll spend time:

  • recruiting, training and supervising junior clerks
  • bringing business into chambers
  • allocating cases to barristers
  • negotiating fees

You'll also be responsible for the financial management of the chambers.

Description.Html: Beauty consultants sell beauty products and help customers choose which ones to buy.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about careers in beauty consultancy and therapy from the Hairdressing and Beauty Industry Authority.

You can also find out more about working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and further training you could move into management.

Description.Html: Beauty therapists provide face and body treatments to help clients look and feel better.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to get professional recognition by joining a register like the Guild of Beauty Therapists.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about careers in beauty therapy from the Hairdressing and Beauty Industry Authority and the British Association of Beauty Therapy and Cosmetology.

You can also find out more about working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could progress to salon manager.

You could become self-employed and get your own salon, work from home or travel to clients.

You could also move into fashion, theatre or media make-up.

Description.Html: Beekeepers manage colonies of honeybees kept in hives to produce honey, beeswax and royal jelly.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a beekeeper through The British Beekeepers Association and the National Bee Unit.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into commercial beekeeping and develop more hives over a wider area.

You could also train new beekeepers.

Description.Html: Bid writers prepare documents used to pitch for contracts to provide services, or to apply for project funding.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Association of Bid Proposal Management Professionals and the Institute of Sales Management for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
A professional marketing qualification may help you find work.

If you're preparing bids for international funding, the ability to speak other languages can help.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a team leader, senior bid writer, or bids and proposals manager.

You could also transfer your skills to other kinds of technical writing or contract management.

Description.Html: Bilingual secretaries provide administrative services in English and one or more foreign languages.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Chartered Institute of Linguists for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Most businesses look for bilingual secretaries who can speak a European language like French, German, Spanish or Italian.

Other languages like Russian, Chinese, Japanese and Arabic are also growing in demand.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll get more advice about working and training in languages through the Chartered Institute of Linguists.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could be promoted to personal assistant or office manager.

You could move into translating or interpreting, or international business, sales or marketing.

Description.Html: Bin workers remove waste and recyclables from homes and businesses for disposal or recycling.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to team leader or supervisor.

With further training you could become a waste management officer or recycling officer.

Description.Html: Biochemists investigate the chemical processes that take place inside all living things, from viruses and bacteria to people.

HtbBodies.Html: Membership of a professional body like the Biochemical Society or the Royal Society of Biology may be useful to reinforce your status as a professional scientist and to help keep your knowledge current.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Integrated master's qualifications like MBiolSci, MBiochem or MSci can be studied at university. These courses combine more independent research and are designed to lead directly onto further postgraduate study like a PhD.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a biochemist from:Biochemical Society; Royal Society of Biology; The Association for Clinical Biochemistry and Laboratory Medicine

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a team leader or manager, running a department, or move into research, sales and marketing, or scientific journalism.

Description.Html: Biologists study living things, like animals and plants.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Royal Society of Biology for your professional career development.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Laboratory experience would be useful for this career.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about careers, courses and training in biology through the Royal Society of Biology and Into Biology.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could move into management, teaching, the media, administration and scientific journalism.

Description.Html: Biomedical scientists screen patient samples and help doctors and healthcare professionals to diagnose and treat disease.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more advice about becoming a biomedical scientist from the Institute of Biomedical Science and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into research, training and education, product development and commerce.

In the NHS, you could work as a team leader, specialist, manager or professional manager with further training and qualifications.

There are opportunities to work as a biomedical scientist in the armed forces. You can find out more from:Army; Royal Air Force; Royal Navy

Description.Html: Biotechnologists use plants, animals, microbes, biochemistry and genetics to develop new products and improve existing ones.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join an organisation like the Science Council for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in biotechnology from:Science Council; Future Morph; Biotechnology and Biological Sciences Research Council

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into scientific journalism, quality assurance management, sales or marketing.

Description.Html: Blacksmiths work with different metals to make and repair decorative, industrial and everyday items.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Artist Blacksmiths Association and The Worshipful Company of Blacksmiths for professional development and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need to show examples of your work and decorative ideas to get onto a design-related course or if contacting blacksmiths about trainee positions.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can get more details about working as an artist blacksmith from the British Artist Blacksmiths Association.

You can also find out more about working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
As an experienced artist blacksmith you could set up your own gallery. You could also teach craft skills.

As an industrial blacksmith, you could move into workshop management. You could also train to become a design engineer.

Description.Html: Boat builders build, repair and refit marine craft from small sailing boats to large sea-going vessels.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join The Institute of Marine Engineering, Science and Technology for professional development training.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a boat builder from The Institute of Marine Engineering, Science and Technology and British Marine.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and qualifications, you could become a marine engineer.

You could also move into boat design, work as an assistant to a naval architect or specialise in maritime equipment sales and support.

You could use your skills to transfer to other branches of engineering or into construction.

Description.Html: Bodyguards protect individuals or groups from the risk of violence, kidnapping and other harmful situations.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Many people enter this career after working in the police or the armed forces.

It may be useful if you can speak more than one language for certain jobs, for example diplomatic work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about training to be a bodyguard through the Security Industry Authority.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could specialise in surveillance, driving or residential security, or move into risk assessment consultancy work.

Description.Html: Bookbinders turn printed paper into books and catalogues using machines, and traditional hand binding methods for specialist books.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about working in bookbinding and printing from the British Printing Industries Federation and the Heritage Crafts Association.

You can also find out more about working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a supervisor, or work for a specialist print finishing company.

You could also move into other jobs like printing or sales.

As a craft bookbinder, you could improve your job prospects by joining the Society of Bookbinders or Designer Bookbinders.

Description.Html: Bookkeepers keep financial records up to date and help prepare accounts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about training in bookkeeping through The Association of Accounting Technicians and the International Association of Bookkeepers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and training, you could become an accounting technician and take on more complex work.

You could also become self-employed and set up your own business.

You may decide to take a degree and qualify as an accountant.

Description.Html: Bookmakers organise gambling activities in betting offices, at racetracks and online.

HtbCareerTips.Html: When you apply for a job as a bookmaker, you may be asked to sit a basic maths test to show that you can deal with percentages and calculating odds and payments. These tasks are often carried out by electronic tills, but it's important that you're able to explain them to customers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about a career in the gaming industry from the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could manage several shops in a region, or set up your own business.

Description.Html: Booksellers buy books from publishers or wholesalers and sell them to customers.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need sound business skills and a good grasp of the publishing and bookselling industry, if you're looking to open your own bookshop.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more advice about bookselling and setting up your own business through the Booksellers Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With financial backing and a lot of experience, you could open your own bookshop.

You could also work from home as a book dealer, or set up an online bookshop.

Description.Html: Border Force officers protect UK border entry points like ports and airports, by enforcing immigration and customs regulations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a Border Force officer from Border Force and Civil Service Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You'll get continuous training during your first 6 to 12 months. Once you've passed your probationary period, you'll have the full responsibilities of a Border Force officer.

With experience you could become a team leader, or move into a management position. You could also use your skills to train and work with new staff.

You may also be able to apply for roles in other departments of the Home Office or Civil Service.

Description.Html: Botanists study all forms of plant life.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about plant biology through the Royal Society of Biology.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience in industry, you could move into a more senior position. In field research and conservation, you’ll usually need to take on organisational, management or advisory responsibilities in order to progress.

You could move into plant science, investigating biodiversity, crop production and plant diseases.

You could also become a freelance consultant.

Description.Html: Bottlers fill, pack and operate bottling machinery in food, drink and bottling factories.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to team supervisor or manager.

Description.Html: Brewery workers brew and package beer.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It will help if you have enthusiasm for and knowledge of brewing and beers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in the brewing and drinks industry from the British Beer and Pub Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to supervisor.

With further study or training, you could move into technical brewing.

Description.Html: Bricklayers build houses, repair walls and chimneys, and refurbish decorative stonework. They also work on restoration projects.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join an organisation like the Federation of Master Builders for professional recognition and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a bricklayer from Go Construct and House Building Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a construction site supervisor, or move into related areas like estimating or apprentice training.

You could also specialise in heritage work, stonemasonry, or set up your own business.

Description.Html: British Sign Language (BSL) interpreters help deaf and hearing people communicate with one another.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Many interpreters work freelance or through agencies and often get work through recommendations of people who have already used their services. It's important to have knowledge and an appreciation of deaf culture and the issues facing the deaf community.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a British Sign Language interpreter from:Signature; Royal Association for Deaf People; British Deaf Association; Action on Hearing Loss

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could teach and assess others, sign at theatre productions or television performances, or move into research.

You could also become self-employed and work freelance.

Description.Html: British Sign Language (BSL) teachers teach sign language to children, young people and adults, and teach other subjects using sign language.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a British Sign Language teacher from Signature and the Institute of British Sign Language.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a British Sign Language (BSL) teaching co-ordinator in a school or college, or take on responsibility for building links with employers to offer work experience opportunities to students.

You could also do further training to broaden your employment options, including courses in lipspeaking, deafblind communication and deaf awareness.

You could work freelance or set up your own BSL teacher agency, supplying teachers who have BSL skills.

Description.Html: Broadcast engineers make sure television, radio and online programmes are broadcast at the right times and are high quality.

HtbBodies.Html: You can apply for professional registration with the Engineering Council for Information and Communications Technology Technician or Chartered Engineer status. Registration can improve your career prospects.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about working in the media industry from ScreenSkills, ITV Careers and Sky.

You can get information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into management.

You could also work freelance.

Description.Html: Broadcast journalists research and present news stories and factual programmes on TV, radio and the internet.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You could create an online showreel to show potential employers examples of your work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about careers and training in the media through the Broadcast Journalism Training Council.

You can get more information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a studio-based presenter or a special news correspondent.

You could also move into programme making, producing, or management.

Description.Html: Builders' merchants sell building and do-it-yourself products and materials to the building trade and the public.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a builders' merchant from Building Materials Careers and the Builders Merchants Federation.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to supervisor or manager.

Description.Html: Building control officers make sure building regulations are followed.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors or The Chartered Institute of Building to help with your professional development.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers and training in building control from:Chartered Association of Building Engineers; The Chartered Institute of Building; Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could specialise in a particular area like fire safety, or move into technical and planning roles in other departments, for example town planning.

You could also work as a consultant.

Description.Html: Building services engineers design, install and service equipment and systems in buildings like offices, hospitals and shopping centres.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Chartered Institution of Building Services Engineers for access to industry news, study resources and professional development courses.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more advice about careers and qualifications in building services from the Chartered Institution of Building Services Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into senior project management, quantity surveying or engineering design.

You could also work as a consultant.

Description.Html: Building site inspectors check the quality and safety of construction work.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Clerks of Works and Construction Inspectorate, which offers professional development and technical advice to people working in the building industry.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice on how to become a building site inspector from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into site management, building surveying, civil engineering or construction management.

You could also set up your own site inspection business and work as a consultant, or move into training.

You may need to become a member of the Institute of Clerks of Works and Construction Inspectorate (ICWCI).

Description.Html: Building surveyors advise clients about the design, construction, maintenance and repair of buildings.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in surveying through the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors and The Chartered Institute of Building.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into project or senior management.

You could go into partnership in private practice, or become self-employment as a consultant.

You could also move into a related field, like building control.

Description.Html: Building technicians support engineers, surveyors and architects on construction projects.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice on how to become a building technician from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into construction project management or specialise in estimating, CAD drafting or buying.

You could find work with national and international building firms and contractors, central and local government, and organisations that do their own construction work, like utility companies, major retailers and the NHS.

Description.Html: Bus and coach drivers transport passengers on local, national or overseas journeys.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about jobs in the passenger transport and travel industries from Careers That Move.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a service controller or inspector, depot manager or driver training instructor.

You could also set up your own business. For this you'll need the Transport Manager CPC in Passenger Transport. This could be done through a local training provider.

Description.Html: Business advisers give advice and support to new business start-ups and help established businesses to grow.
