HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Enterprise and Entrepreneurs for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can use online social media, like LinkedIn, to promote yourself, build your network and display recommendations from colleagues and clients.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in business advice from Business is Great and your local Growth Hub.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could be employed by a local business support organisation or by a national organisation like the Great Business support line.

You could also get involved with community or social enterprises and charities that support business start ups, or do freelance work.

Description.Html: Business analysts work with organisations to help them change and improve.

HtbCareerTips.Html: A working knowledge of project development methods like Waterfall or Agile can help you get into this career.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a business analyst from:International Institute of Business Analysis UK; The Chartered Institute for IT; Institute of Consulting

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into project management, consulting, or work in different industries.

You could set up your own company and work freelance.

Description.Html: Business development managers find new customers, and persuade existing ones to buy extra services.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Sales Management and The Managing & Marketing Sales Association, for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: In some jobs you could travel around the world to meet customers, so it may be helpful to speak a second language.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to senior development manager, business development executive or marketing director.

You could also use your skills in sales, marketing and project management to move into other areas of business.

Description.Html: Business project managers plan and organise people, tasks and resources to complete a project on time and within budget.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about careers, courses and apprenticeships in project management from:Association for Project Management; Project Management Institute; Chartered Management Institute

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
While you're working, you could study for an industry qualification like PRINCE2 or Agile.

You could also get professional qualifications through:Association for Project Management (APM); Chartered Management Institute (CMI); Project Management Institute (PMI)

If you're working in the IT industry, you could get a certificate in project management through The Chartered Institute for IT (BCS).

With experience, you could move into senior management or become a freelance consultant.

Description.Html: Butchers prepare and sell meat and poultry, and make meat products like sausages, burgers and pies.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Any experience you have working with the public, food or handling cash would be useful for this career.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about becoming a butcher from Tasty Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could work in larger and higher quality independent butchers’ shops, retail chains and supermarkets, or set up your own shop.

You may progress to supervisory or management roles in a supermarket or chain of shops.

You could also work at the Food Standards Agency, checking quality and standards in abattoirs and meat plants.

You could move into catering, meat manufacturing and wholesaling.

Description.Html: Butlers carry out personal and household tasks for their employers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: Once you have a wide range of experience and contacts in the industry, you could look at setting up your own business, like a butler training school or a butler recruitment agency.

Description.Html: Air cabin crew help make sure that airline passengers have a comfortable, safe and pleasant flight.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Some airlines and private providers run 2-day cabin crew courses, which may help your chances of getting a job.

Some airlines also have online career quizzes you can do to test whether working as air cabin crew is for you, before you apply.

Being able to speak a second language gives you an advantage when making applications. You'll also need to demonstrate that you have great customer service skills, so experience of working directly with the public is useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find details about working as air cabin crew from Careers That Move.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to cabin crew supervisor or a senior air cabin crew role.

You could also work in a ground-based job, like cabin crew training, recruitment, passenger services, marketing or sales.

Description.Html: Computer-aided design (CAD) technicians use software to design buildings, machinery, goods and components.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Some colleges may specialise in particular computer-aided design packages, for example:

  • AutoCAD LT
  • Civil 3D
  • SolidWorks
  • Autodesk 3ds Max
  • Revit

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working and training in computer-aided design through Go Construct and The Institution of Engineering Designers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could register with the Engineering Council to get Engineering Technician (EngTech) status.

You could become a team or section leader, project manager or site manager. With further training, you could become a design or software engineer.

You could also work freelance.

Description.Html: Cake decorators design, make and decorate cakes for birthdays, weddings and other special occasions.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
If you're displaying your work online, make sure you:

  • put a watermark on your online images to deter someone from copying them
  • check copyright terms if you're using popular characters or logos in your designs

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about working in the food and drinks industry from Tasty Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could start your own business.

You could also teach cake design.

Description.Html: Call centre operators answer enquiries from customers by telephone, email, webchat, text and post.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Employers look for people with personal qualities like confidence and a good telephone manner. Job interviews often include practical telephone and keyboard tests.

Temporary work can be a useful way to get started in this career and can lead to permanent jobs.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and training, you could progress to team leader and management level.

You could also move into human resources, resource planning, marketing and training.

Description.Html: Car manufacturing workers build motor vehicles by assembling parts on a production line.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and further training, you could become a team supervisor, quality control technician or workshop section leader.

You could also train to work as a maintenance engineer, servicing and repairing the production line machinery.

ContentItemIds: «c#: await Content.GetContentItemIdByDisplayText("Occupation", "rental service representative in cars and light motor vehicles")»

Description.Html: Car rental agents hire out and lease vehicles to businesses and the public.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Having the right personality and good communication skills can be more important than formal qualifications.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a car rental agent through Autocity.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into a supervisory or management post.

With experience in business leasing accounts, you could become an account manager, or move into fleet management.

Description.Html: As a car salesperson you'll sell new and used cars, vans or motorbikes.

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a showroom supervisor, senior sales adviser, dealership administrator, or sales and marketing manager.

You could also move into vehicle leasing or set up your own dealership.

Description.Html: Car valets clean the inside and outside of motor vehicles.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working as a car valet from Autocity.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could go on to start your own business.

Description.Html: Community transport passenger assistants accompany elderly people or adults and children with disabilities, on local journeys.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find details of local organisations through the Community Transport Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into administration or management.

You could also become a driver, which would open up more full-time opportunities.

Description.Html: Care home advocates make sure the views and wishes of residents in care homes are heard.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It might help if you can speak a community language for some jobs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a care home advocate and training from:Older People's Advocacy Alliance; National Development Team for Inclusion; Age UK; Mind

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to a more senior role, like advocacy coordinator.

Description.Html: Care home managers are responsible for the leadership and day-to-day running of residential care homes.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working as a care home manager from Think Care Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a regional manager within a large healthcare company or charity. You could also work as a freelance consultant or a care home inspector.

Description.Html: Care workers help vulnerable people to manage their daily activities and to live as independently as possible.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Time spent caring for someone you know also counts as having experience in a caring role.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in care from:Think Care Careers; Department of Health and Social Care; Social Care TV

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
While employed as a care worker you can develop your skills by training in specific areas, like autism awareness, communication skills or supporting people with dementia.

With experience, you can become a lead care worker. You can also move into more senior jobs, like managing people or services, if you study for further qualifications. For example, a Level 5 Diploma in Leadership and Management for Adult Care, or a degree in social work or nursing.

Description.Html: Careers advisers help people make decisions about their education, training and work options.

HtbBodies.Html: Once you're qualified, you can apply to join the Career Development Institute’s UK register of career development professionals.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a careers adviser from the Career Development Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could specialise and work with adults or people with special needs.

With experience, you could become a manager. You could also become self-employed and work as a consultant, researcher or writer.

Another option could be to move into industry and provide career management advice for employees of large companies.

Description.Html: Caretakers look after buildings like schools, community centres and flats, keeping them secure, clean and well-maintained.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a supervisor or move into facility services or cleaning management. You could also work in related areas or roles, for example commercial property maintenance, or as an accommodation warden with a housing association.

Description.Html: Carpenters and joiners make and install wooden structures, fittings and furniture.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a carpenter from Go Construct and House Building Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a team leader or project manager.

You could also move into construction estimating and contracts management, or specialise in areas like stage sets or heritage restoration.

You could also start your own business or move into training.

Description.Html: Carpet fitters and floor layers fit carpets and vinyl tiles, and lay laminate and solid timber floors.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about training and working in carpet fitting and floor laying from Go Construct and The Flooring Industry Training Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a team supervisor, estimator or contracts manager.

You could move into areas like buying and product sales.

You could also set up your own business in laying carpets and flooring.

Description.Html: Cartographers collect information about the geography of an area to design and produce maps, charts and plans.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about a career in cartography from the British Cartographic Society and Ordnance Survey.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a senior cartographer and manage mapping projects and staff.

If you specialise in working with GIS, you could apply for Chartered Geographer (GIS) status.

You could also work on a freelance basis, but you’ll need your own mapping equipment.

Description.Html: Catering managers run the food service of organisations including restaurants, bars, schools, colleges and outside suppliers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about catering careers from the Hospitality Guild and CareerScope.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into larger organisations or those offering more specialised work like event catering.

You could also study for further qualifications in hospitality.

Another option is to start your own contract catering business.

Description.Html: Cavity insulation installers fit insulation and soundproofing materials in buildings.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in cavity insulation from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a team leader or estimator, set up your own installation business, or move into wider construction trades.

Description.Html: Celebrants conduct personalised wedding, naming and funeral ceremonies. They also help mark other important occasions and relationships.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Celebrants are usually self-employed and often combine their work with a second career, for example wedding planning, events management or funeral directing.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find many celebrant organisations online, who offer information on how to become a celebrant, training courses and the different types of ceremonies they conduct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
As an experienced celebrant, you may wish to train in conducting different types of ceremonies, or set up your own celebrant training business. You could also offer related services, like wedding or event planning.

You could use your skills to move into areas like counselling, for example bereavement counselling or family mediation.

Description.Html: Cellar technicians install and maintain drinks systems in places like pubs, bars, hotels and restaurants.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Institute of Innkeeping for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could become a supervisor, manager, or move into equipment services and sales.

Description.Html: Cemetery workers prepare and maintain graves and memorial sites.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working and training in cemetery work through the Institute of Cemetery and Crematorium Management.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to being a supervisor. If your job involves clerical duties, you could train for progression into cemetery administration.

Description.Html: Ceramics designer-makers design and create products made from clay.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need to put together a portfolio of work that you can show to potential employers and course providers. You can also develop your own blog and website or use social media to market yourself as a designer and get your work recognised.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about working in ceramics from the Crafts Council.

You can also explore other creative careers at Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could become a senior designer, or you could go freelance or set up your own business.

Description.Html: Charity directors plan ways to develop a charity's services, generate income and raise awareness of its work.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Excellent presentation and confident public speaking skills are essential.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in the charity sector from The National Council for Voluntary Organisations.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could move to a bigger charity, work for an international non-governmental organisation (NGO), or become a consultant, advising charities and government on policy.

Description.Html: Charity fundraisers organise events and activities to encourage people to donate to causes and organisations.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Employers will usually be more interested in your skills, experience and commitment to working in the charity sector than in your formal qualifications.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working and training in the charity sector through the Institute of Fundraising and CharityJob.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work towards a professional qualification from the Institute of Fundraising.

With experience, you could move into charity management, or become a self-employed fundraising consultant.

Description.Html: Chauffeurs drive clients from place to place, making sure their journey is safe and comfortable, and that they arrive on time.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll find it useful to have car maintenance skills.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more on working in the passenger transport industry from Careers That Move.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could go on to set up your own business.

You could also be a 'lead driver' and train other chauffeurs.

Description.Html: Checkout operators serve customers at tills in supermarkets and large retail stores.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a supervisor or manager.

Larger companies are likely to offer you more chance of promotion.

Description.Html: Chefs prepare, cook and present food in hotels, bars and restaurants.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a chef from the Hospitality Guild and CareerScope.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to section chef (station chef) and look after a particular area like desserts. The next step is sous chef, running an entire kitchen when the head chef is busy.

As head chef (also known as chef de cuisine), you'll run a kitchen, create menus and manage the budget.

You could move into the business side by taking a foundation degree or degree in hospitality management.

Very large establishments have executive chefs, usually in charge of multiple outlets. This is a management role and you would do very little cooking.

Another option is to train as a teacher or assessor working for a college or training provider.

Description.Html: Chemical engineers develop ways to turn raw materials into everyday products.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Institution of Chemical Engineers for professional development opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about careers and training in chemical engineering through the Institution of Chemical Engineers and Whynotchemeng.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to senior process or design engineer, research and development manager. You could go on to be a plant manager, or overall operations manager.

You could also move into consultancy work.

Description.Html: Chemical engineering technicians help to research, develop and manufacture plastics, medicines, foods, textiles and fuel.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Institution of Chemical Engineers for professional development opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about careers and training in the chemical industry from the Institution of Chemical Engineers and Cogent Skills.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a shift supervisor, eventually moving into maintenance or production management.

You could also move into materials development and design, quality control or sales and marketing.

Description.Html: Chemical plant process operators control machinery that makes chemical products, like paints, cleaning fluids and cosmetics.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Previous experience in the manufacturing and processing industries would be an advantage.

A forklift truck certificate may be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more on careers in the chemicals industry from Cogent Skills.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into quality control, lab work, maintenance or shift management.

With further study, you could become a process technician.

Description.Html: Chemists study chemicals and materials and how they behave under different conditions.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Laboratory experience would be useful for this career.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about becoming a chemist from A Future in Chemistry and the Science Council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You'll usually be able to find work with a wide range of employers including the NHS, public health laboratories, research institutes and government agencies.

As a chemist working in industry, you could be involved in research and development, patent work, health and safety or forensic science.

You could also move into teaching or a career in the media.

As an experienced chemist you could work towardschartered status like Chartered Chemist (CChem) and Chartered Scientist (CSci).

Description.Html: Chief executives plan and put into place policies to help their organisations be successful.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need a very strong commitment to the organisation's aims.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could also work as a management consultant, advising clients on commercial strategy and policy.

Description.Html: Chief inspectors manage operational teams in their districts like CID or neighbourhood policing, co-ordinating responses to major incidents.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about becoming a senior officer through the College of Policing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and further training, you could move up the policing ranks from chief inspector to superintendent, and on to assistant chief constable and chief constable.

You could also work for the security services, MI5 and MI6, Civil Nuclear Constabulary or Ministry of Defence.

Description.Html: Child protection officers promote children's wellbeing and protect them from harm or abuse.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Association of Child Protection Professionals for career development opportunities and to meet others doing this job.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in child protection from the British Association of Social Workers and NSPCC Learning.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a lead officer, co-ordinating the work of your organisation's child protection team.

You could also work for safeguarding partnerships between local authorities, schools, health bodies, charities and social services.

With further training and experience, you could become a children's services inspector or a self-employed consultant, delivering training and advising organisations on child protection policies and regulations.

Description.Html: Childminders care for babies, toddlers and children in their own home, supporting their learning and development.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
It's a good idea to do some research where you live to find out if there is a demand for childminders in your local area.

You may need to budget to pay for courses, including first aid, health and safety, and safeguarding. There is a fee for registering with Ofsted and you may need to pay for a medical check.

As you'll be self-employed you might find it useful to find out more about your responsibilities for tax and taking out insurance. You can get advice about this from GOV.UK.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You'll find details about careers and courses in childcare from the Professional Association for Childcare and Early Years and the Pre-school Learning Alliance.

You can find out more about childcare training routes on the early years career progression map.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could expand your business and take on a childcare assistant. You could also become a network co-ordinator, supporting other local childminders.

With further training you could become a tutor on childminding courses. You could also move into a related job like nursery worker, playworker, community play leader or teaching assistant.

Description.Html: Children's nurses provide care for children and young people with acute or long-term health problems.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about how to become a children's nurse from the Royal College of Nursing and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into a specialised area like:

  • burns and plastics
  • child protection
  • cancer care
  • neonatal nursing
  • intensive care

You could also become a sister, ward manager or team leader. In these roles you'd have responsibility for running a ward or a team of nurses in the community.

Other management roles you could work towards include matron or director of nursing.

You could train as a health visitor, neonatal or school nurse, or practice nurse in a doctor's surgery. You could also become self-employed or work overseas.

With further study and experience, you could move into a nurse consultant position. In this job you'd work with patients to carry out research. You'd also develop and deliver training.

Description.Html: Chimney sweeps clean the chimneys and flues of open fires and other coal, gas, oil and wood-fired heating systems.

HtbBodies.Html:
You could join:National Association of Chimney Sweeps; The Guild of Master Chimney Sweeps; Association of Professional and Independent Chimney Sweeps; Sweep Safe

They offer training and professional development opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Many chimney sweeps set up their own business once they have some experience.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in chimney sweeping and flue engineering through Become a Chimney Sweep and Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You'll usually be self-employed, although you may also find jobs with private companies like solid fuel distributors.

It may be possible to buy an existing business.

Description.Html: Chiropractors manipulate joints, bones and soft tissue to help clients control pain or prevent injuries from re-occurring.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a chiropractor from the General Chiropractic Council and the British Chiropractic Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could set up your own practice.

You could also move into education, or specialise in sports medicine, rehabilitation, neurology or research.

Description.Html: Choreographers design sequences of steps and movements, usually accompanied by music, for dancers and other artists to perform.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join One Dance UK for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can find professional choreographers in the UK Directory of Choreographers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming a choreographer from One Dance UK.

You can get more information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You're likely to work freelance on a fixed-term contract. You may be able to find full-time permanent opportunities with dance companies.

Description.Html: Cinema and theatre attendants help customers visiting entertainment shows.

HtbCareerTips.Html: An interest in film or the arts would be helpful.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could become a cashier, team leader or manager.

Description.Html: Cinema projectionists operate the equipment that shows films in cinemas.

HtbCareerTips.Html: A keen interest and knowledge of UK, US and world cinema will be helpful. Joining a film club can be a good way of developing your knowledge of film formats and projection equipment.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about careers in film from Screen Skills

You can also find out more about working in the creative industries from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a head projectionist or move into programme management, selecting and scheduling films to be shown.

Description.Html: Civil enforcement officers make sure drivers follow parking regulations on public streets and in car parks.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a civil enforcement officer from the British Parking Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and further training you could progress to a senior enforcement officer, supervisor or parking manager role.

The [British Parking Association | http://www.britishparking.co.uk/Parking-Qualifications ] has details of professional parking qualifications.

Description.Html: Civil engineers design and manage construction projects, from bridges and buildings to transport links and sports stadiums.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Institution of Civil Engineers for professional development opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a civil engineer from the Institution of Civil Engineers and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With incorporated or chartered engineer status, you could move into senior project management roles. You could also specialise in a particular engineering field, work in research or become a consultant. You could work overseas with British consulting firms, and for oil and mining companies.

You could also work for international development and disaster relief agencies.

Description.Html: Civil engineering technicians give technical support to engineers on construction projects.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Institution of Civil Engineers for professional development opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about careers in engineering from the Institution of Civil Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to supervisory or site management roles, or specialise in particular areas of the job, like construction design or estimating.

Description.Html: Civil Service administrative officers work in government departments, carrying out policies and running services for the public.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Movement to Work offers work experience opportunities in the Civil Service for unemployed young people.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as an administrative officer from Civil Service Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you'll deal with more complex enquiries, or take on more specialist work related to your department.

With further training, you could apply to become a Civil Service executive officer.

Description.Html: Civil Service executive officers work in government departments that develop policies and provide services to the public.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
The Summer Diversity Internship Programme helps graduates and undergraduates from ethnic minorities and under-represented backgrounds transfer to the Fast Stream scheme.

Movement to Work offers work experience opportunities in the Civil Service for unemployed young people.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about how to become an executive officer from Civil Service Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, there’s often the opportunity to apply for jobs in different departments.

There is a clear promotion structure in the Civil Service. If you’re on the Fast Stream you can expect to reach senior level in around 5 years.

Description.Html: Civil Service managers work in government departments, managing teams that establish policies and provide public services.

HtbCareerTips.Html: The Summer Diversity Internship Programme and Early Diversity Internship Programme help graduates and undergraduates from ethnic minorities and under-represented backgrounds to find out what it’s like to work in the Civil Service.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about working in management from Civil Service Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress through the senior Civil Service management structure, becoming deputy director or director of a department. You could also become a senior policy adviser or permanent secretary, setting departmental strategy and supporting government ministers.

You could use your management skills and experience to work for other public sector organisations or move into the private sector.

Description.Html: Classical musicians and singers perform music in concert, or on film, TV, or radio recordings.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Musicians' Union or the Incorporated Society of Musicians for access to training, events and networking opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You should get as much experience as you can of performing in public. You could do this by joining a youth or community orchestra, and by entering competitions.

The BBC Introducing programme could be a way to get your music heard on the radio, if you're an unsigned musician.

It's common for musicians to showcase their music on networking websites, social media or send a demo to recording companies. The Musicians' Union has more details on how to promote yourself.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can get more advice about working in music from the Incorporated Society of Musicians.

You can also find out more about working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress in an orchestra to principal player or section leader. You could move into conducting, or start your own ensemble.

Description.Html: Cleaners carry out general cleaning of offices, shops and homes, or more specialised cleaning like upholstery or the outsides of buildings.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in cleaning from The British Institute of Cleaning Science.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into specialist cleaning, or a more senior managerial or supervisory role.

You could also start your own business.

Description.Html: Climate scientists study the influences on the Earth's climate over time and how these might affect it in the future.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can get information about global climate conditions through NASA and the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can discover more about working in climate science from the Royal Meteorological Society and the Natural Environment Research Council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could specialise in an area of climate science, for example polar research, rainfall patterns or ocean changes. You might do this through research and teaching at a university, or by working for a government department.

You could also work as a palaeoclimatologist, studying previous variations in climate and how the Earth adapted to these.

Other career options include working as a consultant for science publishers or broadcasters.

You may be able to apply for chartered environmentalist status. You can find out more about being a chartered environmentalist from the Society for the Environment.

Description.Html: Clinical engineers design, develop and maintain equipment for diagnosing illness and treating patients.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a clinical engineer from Health Careers and Institute of Physics and Engineering in Medicine.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and further training, you could become a consultant, specialising in particular clinical areas, or move into management, teaching or medical research.

Description.Html: Clinical psychologists help people to deal with mental health issues, phobias and addiction.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join The British Psychological Society for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You’ll find more about careers in clinical psychology from The British Psychological Society and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work with particular groups like children, young offenders or people with addictions.

With further training, you could specialise in clinical neuropsychology, or move into research or university teaching.

You might also work as a freelance consultant, advising other professionals and clients, or set up your own psychology practice.

Description.Html: Clinical scientists research and develop techniques and equipment to help prevent, diagnose and treat illness.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a clinical scientist from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into management or teaching.

You could also go on to study for a PhD or apply for the NHS Higher Specialist Scientific Training Programme (HSST).

Description.Html: Computer numerically controlled (CNC) machinists make precision parts for the engineering and manufacturing industries.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about engineering careers from Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and further training, you could move into a supervisory role.

You could also move into quality inspection or become an engineering technician.

Description.Html: Coastguards help prevent the loss of life at sea by supporting search and rescue operations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a coastguard from the Maritime and Coastguard Agency and Civil Service Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could be promoted from coastguard watch assistant to watch officer, then to watch manager or section manager.

Description.Html: Cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) practitioners use talking therapy to help patients change negative patterns of thinking or behaviour.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Association for Behavioural and Cognitive Psychotherapies for professional accreditation and training opportunites.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about routes to qualifying through the British Association for Behavioural and Cognitive Psychotherapies and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could supervise other CBT practitioners.

You could set up your own practice, working as an independent practitioner and seeing patients privately.

You could also specialise in teaching or research for a healthcare trust, college or university.

Description.Html: Commercial energy assessors test how energy-efficient commercial buildings are and produce Non-Domestic Energy Performance Certificates.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: Landmark operate the non-domestic energy assessor register on behalf of the government.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With further training you could carry out low carbon assessments, or move into sustainability consultancy.

You could also move into assessor training, teaching the Certificate and Diploma.

Description.Html: Commissioning editors commission or buy authors, book titles or ideas for publication.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join organisations like the The Publishers Association and Professional Publishers Association for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming a commissioning editor from:The Publishers Association; Society for Editors and Proofreaders

You can also get information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move on to be a senior commissioning editor, editorial manager, director, or work as a freelance consultant.

Description.Html: Communication support workers (CSWs) help deaf students in education.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working in communication support from Signature.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into a management position within sensory impairment or disability services. With further training, you could progress to become a sign language interpreter, a disability adviser or a teacher of the deaf.

There are some opportunities to use sign language skills in theatre, television, multimedia production and courts of law. Signers are sometimes booked to interpret in interviews.

Description.Html: Community arts workers help local communities plan and take part in activities like drama, dance, painting and photography.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience is just as important for getting onto a community arts course as it is for finding paid work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more on working in community arts and creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could work freelance and run larger projects with bigger budgets.

In larger organisations, you could move into a more senior or management role.

Description.Html: Community development workers help people to improve the quality of life in their local area.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about working in community development from your local council and locality.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could specialise in a particular issue or broaden your experience and work with different issues or groups.

You could move into management, policy making, or work as a freelance trainer or consultant.

Description.Html: Community education co-ordinators make sure education, training and recreation courses meet the needs of the local community.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about working in the community from your local council and locality.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into management.

You could specialise in working with particular groups, training, or move into consultancy work.

You could also move into community development work.

Description.Html: Community matrons provide care and support to people with long-term or complicated health conditions.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in healthcare from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to service management level and become head of community nursing.

You could also move into health promotion work, teaching or training.

Description.Html: Community transport drivers provide a door-to-door service for people who can't easily use public transport.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a community transport driver from the Community Transport Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to operations or service manager.

With the right licence, you could also move into other areas of driving, or, with further training, into vehicle maintenance and repair.

Description.Html: Company secretaries make sure that directors follow company law and financial regulations.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join ICSA: The Governance Institute for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a company secretary from ICSA: The Governance Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a company's chief executive or managing director.

You could also work freelance as a consultant or a part-time company secretary for several smaller businesses.

Description.Html: Computer games developers make games that can be played online, and on mobile phones, PCs and games consoles.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can create a portfolio of work or online demo to highlight your skills to potential employers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working in games development from ScreenSkills.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior developer, producer or technical director.

If you develop your own successful game independently, you could increase your income significantly.

Description.Html: Computer games testers play computer games to check they work, and find and record problems or ‘bugs’.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Some games companies release test versions of games for the public to try. Going to games events and joining industry forums are good ways to hear about these and other opportunities. They're also useful for making contacts with people working in the industry, who may help you to find work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You'll find more advice about working in gaming from ScreenSkills.

You can also find out more about working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a quality assurance manager or move into games marketing.

With further training, you could become a games designer, animator or developer.

Description.Html: Conference and exhibition managers plan and run events like trade shows, conferences and exhibitions.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Employers will usually look for relevant experience and strong transferable skills like organising, budget management and marketing. Any experience you have in hotel conference and banqueting, travel, sales, PR or fundraising can be especially useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in conferences, exhibitions and events from the Association of British Professional Conference Organisers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work for an events management company, exhibition venue or marketing department of a large organisation. With experience, you could take on bigger events and move into management.

You could also set up your own consultancy.

Description.Html: Conservators preserve and restore historical objects, artworks and buildings.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about careers in conservation from The Institute of Conservation.

You can also find out more about working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could move into a management job, although this will usually mean stepping away from 'hands on' practical conservation work.

Description.Html: Construction contracts managers manage building contracts and construction costs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about working and training in contract management through Go Construct and The Chartered Institute of Building.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to general construction management, consultancy or become a company director.

You could also move into support services, like health and safety inspection, or you could use your contracting knowledge to move into other sectors.

Description.Html: Construction labourers prepare building and civil engineering sites and carry out manual jobs once work starts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in construction from Go Construct and House Building Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could train on the job to become a qualified tradesperson or with experience, become a site supervisor, estimator or construction manager.

Description.Html: Construction managers organise the work on building projects, making sure it's completed safely, within budget and on time.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a construction manager from Go Construct and The Chartered Institute of Building.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress into contract management or consultancy. With further training, you could move into support services like health and safety and building inspection.

You can improve your career prospects by getting chartered status, through an industry body like the The Chartered Institute of Building.

Description.Html: Construction plant hire advisers rent out plant machinery, tools and equipment to builders and the public.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Hire Association Europe for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in construction equipment hire from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could become a store supervisor then manager. You could also move into equipment servicing or do training to work as a construction plant engineer.

Description.Html: Construction plant mechanics make sure that heavy plant machinery like diggers and dumper trucks is well maintained and working safely.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may have an advantage when looking for work if you have experience or qualifications in large goods vehicle mechanics or mechanical and electrical engineering maintenance.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more on working with plant machinery from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to construction plant technician, technical service representative, site supervisor or site manager.

You could also set up your own business.

Description.Html: Construction plant operators work with machinery and equipment used on building sites.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a construction plant operator from Go Construct and the Construction Plant-hire Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into construction management, site supervision, estimating, lift planning and supervision.

You could become a plant or crane supervisor, or a plant coordinator selecting the machinery needed for each new job and assessing new equipment.

You could also move into selling plant equipment.

Description.Html: Construction site supervisors manage staff and subcontractors on building sites.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Clerks of Works and Construction Inspectorate for professional development and advice on technical matters.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more about training and working in construction from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could specialise in health and safety, contract management or move into general construction management.

Description.Html: Consumer scientists study why people use or buy products and services, and give advice to retailers and manufacturers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could progress into a management post.

With training you could use your experience to move into a career in teaching.

Description.Html: Copy editors check text before it's published in books, journals and websites.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join a professional organisation like The Society for Editors and Proofreaders (SfEP).

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Employers will often expect you to have some experience in the publishing industry.

You could get experience in the publishing industry from:

  • job shadowing
  • editing and proofreading student magazines and websites
  • admin work in a publishing company

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
The Society for Editors and Proofreaders (SfEP) and the Publishing Training Centre have further details on training options.

You can also find out more about working in this and other creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could become a features writer, chief sub-editor or production editor. Some sub-editors go freelance.

Description.Html: Coroners look into deaths from unnatural or unknown causes, or those that have happened suddenly or in prison or police custody.

HtbCareerTips.Html: A few coroners have qualifications in both law and medicine.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a coroner from the Courts and Tribunals Judiciary.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you can apply for the position of senior coroner, with chief coroner the most senior position.

You can also apply to become a course director with the Judicial College.

Description.Html: Cosmetic surgeons treat people who choose to alter their appearance. Plastic surgeons repair tissue damaged through illness or injury.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a cosmetic or plastic surgeon from the British Association of Plastic Reconstructive and Aesthetic Surgeons and the Royal College of Surgeons.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could specialise in particular forms of surgery, for example dealing with burns or scarring. With experience, you could apply for senior or consultant roles, leading a team of surgeons or managing a hospital surgery department.

You could also move into teaching and training student surgeons, or set up your own private practice, offering cosmetic procedures.

Description.Html: Costume designers are responsible for the overall look of the clothes and costumes in theatre, film or television productions.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join The Society of British Theatre Designers and The Costume Society, for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming a costume designer from:Royal Opera House; ScreenSkills

You can also get more details about working in the creative industries from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You’ll specialise in either theatre or in film and TV, but you could work in both areas once you’re established.

Description.Html: Counsellors help people discuss their problems and feelings in a confidential setting.

HtbBodies.Html: Becoming a member of a body on the Professional Standards Authority's counselling register can improve your chances of getting a job.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You'll be expected to undergo therapy yourself and regularly reflect on your practice with a supervisor, as this is needed for accreditation.

Counselling is often a second or third career, and life experience is highly valued.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in counselling from the British Association for Counselling and Psychotherapy and the UK Council for Psychotherapy.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Competition for full-time paid work is strong and many counsellors do a mix of part-time, voluntary and private work.

It's important for newly qualified counsellors to get peer support to develop their skills, so it's unusual to go straight into working for yourself.

Counsellors often specialise in a particular area, for example bereavement support, relationships or addiction. With experience, you could set up your own practice.

You could choose to train as a counsellor supervisor or trainer. You could also move into a management or consultancy role.

Description.Html: Counter service assistants greet, serve and take payment from customers buying food and drink.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about working in counter service from the Hospitality Guild.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a supervisor or manager.

Description.Html: Countryside officers manage, protect and improve the rural environment.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about countryside careers from the National Land Based College and Grow Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and further qualifications, you could become a senior countryside officer or manager and then regional manager.

Description.Html: Countryside rangers look after green spaces, woodlands and animal habitats that allow entry to the public.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Countryside Management Association for professional development training and to build up your contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: A first aid qualification may help when applying for jobs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about working as a countryside ranger through National Parks and the National Land Based College.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could join a professional body like the Countryside Management Association, which may improve your career prospects.

With experience, you could become a senior, district or head ranger or warden. You could also become a countryside officer.

Another option is to move into more specialised work like forestry or coastal area management, or wildlife conservation.

Description.Html: Couriers collect packages, documents and messages, and deliver them to customers.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join organisations like the Institute of Couriers for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: A basic knowledge of vehicle maintenance could help you when looking for work.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a depot controller or start your own courier business.

You could also train to drive large goods vehicles (LGVs).

Description.Html: Court administrative assistants help with the daily running of courts and their supporting offices.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about careers in the courts and tribunals service from Skills for Justice.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress from administrative assistant to administrative officer and then to executive officer or team manager.

Description.Html: Court legal advisers are trained lawyers who advise magistrates and district judges about the law.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: The Bar Council and The Law Society have more information about legal careers and training.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
The legal adviser career structure has 5 levels, known as tiers. On any tier, you could become a mentor. To move up, you'll need to prove your ability in your current role.

With 5 years' experience, you could become a deputy district judge or district judge (magistrates' courts). With more experience, you could become a justices' clerk (running several courts).

You could also apply for legal and non-legal secondments within the wider departments of Her Majesty's Courts and Tribunal Service (HMCTS), the Ministry of Justice and other government agencies.

Another option is to move into private practice as a solicitor or barrister, or join the Crown Prosecution Service as a crown prosecutor or crown advocate.

Description.Html: Court ushers make sure that everyone involved with a court case is present and that they know what to do.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in the courts and tribunals service from Skills for Justice.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could supervise a team of ushers, or become a court administrative officer.

Description.Html: Crane drivers operate lifting machinery on construction, quarrying and mining sites, at ports and in warehouses.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may find it useful if you've got experience as an operative in construction, mechanical engineering or plant operations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about training and working as a crane driver from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and a Level 3 or 4 NVQ Diploma in Lifting Operations, you could become a crane supervisor, directing operations.

After further training you may be able to work as a site manager, with responsibility for the day-to-day running of a construction or quarrying site.

Description.Html: Credit controllers help firms get the money they are owed from businesses and individuals.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details on working in credit control, and specialist in-work qualifications, from the Chartered Institute of Credit Management.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and professional qualifications, you could be promoted to credit manager.

You could also start your own collection agency or set up as a freelance field collection agent.

Description.Html: Credit managers control the amount of finance offered by their company and manage the debts owed to it.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in credit control from the Chartered Institute of Credit Management.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress into senior management or move to a larger company.

Alternatively, you could move into insolvency work with an accountancy firm or become a self-employed consultant, advising businesses on credit systems.
